body:
The issue was that if the identity node was the first node in the engine, the input tensor would be renamed from InputPH_0 to something like Identity. This will cause runtime error when the binding for InputPH_0 can't be found. It actually looks like you fixed this in a different way: https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/09c215a9c134dcc52882b153973617e125ad300b/tensorflow/contrib/tensorrt/convert/convert_nodes.cc#L727
However, your solution causes none of the tensors to have their names set - by default TRT names new tensors like "(Unamed Tensor* 1)" etc. but it looks like you check for nullptr or a len of 0.

body_text:
The issue was that if the identity node was the first node in the engine, the input tensor would be renamed from InputPH_0 to something like Identity. This will cause runtime error when the binding for InputPH_0 can't be found. It actually looks like you fixed this in a different way: 
  
    
      tensorflow/tensorflow/contrib/tensorrt/convert/convert_nodes.cc
    
    
         Line 727
      in
      09c215a
    
    
    
    

        
          
           // We need to check the name before setting it. For Identity op where the 
        
    
  


However, your solution causes none of the tensors to have their names set - by default TRT names new tensors like "(Unamed Tensor* 1)" etc. but it looks like you check for nullptr or a len of 0.
